lead_paragraph: Nearly $1.3 billion in cuts by Gov. Bill Walker mean that people will receive less money from the state every month, and public schools will receive less aid.

headline.print_headline: Drop in Oil Prices Now Hits Home in Alaska
headline.main: Alaskans Brace for Spending Cuts as Oil Prices Tumble

snippet: Nearly $1.3 billion in cuts by Gov. Bill Walker mean that people will receive less money from the state every month, and public schools will receive less aid....
abstract: Alaska's State House of Representatives fails to override Gov Bill Walker's line-item veto of budget, which will result in $1.3 billion in spending cuts almost certainly taking effect, in addition to other cuts already agreed upon by Legislature; cuts are linked to drop in oil prices, and effects will be felt in every part of state.
